headlines: India buys 45,000 tonnes of Russian sunflower oil at record high price: Report
text: India has contracted 45,000 tonnes of Russian sunflower oil at a record high price for shipments in April, Reuters reported on Tuesday citing industry officials. The move comes as oil prices in the local market surged after supplies from Ukraine stopped because of the war. Refiners bought crude sunflower oil at a record price of $2,150 a tonne, dealers said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 7th time in 8 days
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the seventh time in eight days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹100.21/litre after being increased by 80 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹91.47/litre from ₹90.77/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹115.04/litre from ₹114.19/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹99.25/litre from ₹98.50/litre.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: India-born Raj Subramaniam named new FedEx CEO as Founder steps down after 50 yrs
text: FedEx has named India-born Raj Subramaniam as its new CEO as the company's Founder Frederich W Smith will step down after around five decades, effective June 1, 2022. Subramaniam is currently President and Chief Operating Officer. He will be promoted to President and CEO, while 77-year-old Smith will become Executive Chairman. "Fred is a...legend of the business world," Subramaniam said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Who is Namit Malhotra, CEO of VFX company that won 'Dune' an Oscar?
text: Union I&B Minister Anurag Thakur congratulated UK-based Namit Malhotra, the CEO of DNEG visual effects company behind the movie 'Dune', which won the Best Visual Effects Oscar on Monday. Malhotra's DNEG also worked on the movie 'No Time to Die', which was nominated for Oscars. Malhotra's grandfather has worked as a cinematographer, and his father as a producer, in Bollywood.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: No plan to buy crude oil from Russia in Indian rupees: Govt
text: Rameswar Teli, the Minister of State in the Petroleum Ministry, said, "Oil public sector undertakings neither have any contract nor is any such proposal under consideration from Russia or any other country for the purchase of crude oil in Indian rupees." He clarified this in Parliament on Monday. This comes amid Indian companies buying Russian oil following deep discounts.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I'm practically under house arrest, have to eat at home: Sanctioned Russian oligarch
text: London-based Russian oligarch Mikhail Fridman said he's "practically under house arrest" and has to eat at home because all his cards and bank accounts are blocked due to sanctions. "Authorities in Great Britain...assign me a certain amount so I can take taxis and buy food," he told a newspaper. Fridman has a fortune of over $10 billion, as per Bloomberg.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 20,000 bankers sleeping in offices to beat COVID-19 lockdown in Shanghai
text: Over 20,000 bankers, traders and other workers are sleeping in their office towers in Shanghai's Lujiazui district to keep China's financial hub working through the COVID-19 lockdown. Brokerages, asset managers and financial exchanges in Lujiazui summoned key workers to offices ahead of Monday's lockdown. Arrangements were made for sleeping bags and basic supplies for workers' overnight stays.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: After Heineken, Carlsberg says it will exit Russia
text: Danish brewer Carlsberg has announced that it has "taken the difficult and immediate decision" to exit the Russian market, following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Carlsberg will incur a substantial non-cash impairment charge and will have no presence in Russia after full disposal of its business, the company said. Earlier, Dutch brewer Heineken said it will exit its business in Russia.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Heineken to exit Russia at a cost of $438 million
text: Dutch brewing major Heineken is exiting its business in Russia at an expected cost of $438 million, following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Previously, the beer maker had said that it would only halt new investment and exports to the country. "Heineken's ownership of the business in Russia is no longer sustainable nor viable in the current environment," the company said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: ₹95.86 crore recovered from 11 crypto exchanges for GST evasion: Govt
text: The government has recovered ₹95.86 crore, including interest and penalty charges, from 11 cryptocurrency exchanges for evading Goods and Services Tax (GST), Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said. He told the Lok Sabha that the exchanges were investigated for evading ₹81.54 crore in taxes. The biggest evasion was detected at WazirX, followed by CoinDCX and CoinSwitch Kuber.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Singapore's e-commerce platform Shopee to shut down India operations
text: Shopee, the e-commerce arm of Singapore-headquartered Sea Ltd, on Monday announced it's closing down India operations citing "global market uncertainties". The development comes over a month after the Indian government banned Sea's Garena Free Fire gaming app. "[We'll work] to support local seller and buyer communities and our local team to make the process as smooth as possible," Shopee said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I supposedly have COVID-19 again, but almost no symptoms: Musk
text: World’s richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Monday tweeted that he might have contracted COVID-19 again. Musk tweeted, "COVID-19 is the virus of Theseus. How many gene changes before it’s not COVID-19 anymore? I supposedly have it again (sigh), but almost no symptoms." Earlier in November 2020, Musk revealed that he had a moderate case of COVID-19.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Stop forcing people to pay for news: Musk to Bezos-owned Washington Post
text: World's richest person Elon Musk has accused the Washington Post of editorialising his comments for a story. "Here's what I actually said: 'If you're so concerned about democracy, stop forcing people to pay for (allegedly) important news! Your boss (Jeff) Bezos can certainly afford it'," Musk wrote on Twitter. Amazon's billionaire Founder Bezos bought the Washington Post in 2013.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 7 Indian-origin persons charged for insider trading worth million dollars in US
text: Seven Indian-origin persons have been charged by US federal authorities with insider trading in a scheme through which they allegedly made over $1 million in illegal profits. Three of them were software engineers at California-based Twilio. They knowingly tipped off four family members and friends to trade in Twilio's options ahead of its 2020 earnings announcement, according to the complaint.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Tesla adds $84 billion to its value in 1 day, more than Ford's entire market cap
text: Tesla shares added $84 billion to their market value on Monday, more than Ford's entire market capitalisation. The stock surged after the electric car maker said it is planning a second stock split in about two years. Tesla's current market value stands at $1.13 trillion. When Tesla split its stock in August 2020, its share price rose 743% that year.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Hero MotoCorp made ₹1,000 crore bogus expenses, I-T dept reportedly finds
text: The I-T department, in a recent search operation at Hero MotoCorp-linked premises, reportedly found that the company made over ₹1000 crore in bogus expenses. It also found that Chairman and MD Pawan Munjal used black money to pay over ₹100 crore in cash to buy a farmhouse in Delhi, ANI reported citing sources. The company's shares fell over 7%.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Bank transactions worth ₹18,000 crore hit by Bharat Bandh: Industry body
text: The All India Bank Employees Association said that the two-day Bharat Bandh against the Central government's policies affecting workers has halted banking transactions worth at least ₹18,000 crore. In the southern grid functioning in Chennai, six lakh cheques couldn't be cleared, AIBEA's General Secretary CH Venkatachalam said. "We regret the inconvenience caused to the banking public," he added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russia's Gazprom seeks gas payments in euros from GAIL amid sanctions: Report
text: Russian government-controlled energy firm Gazprom has asked India’s GAIL to pay for gas imports in euros instead of dollars, said two sources. This comes amid Russia facing various sanctions from European countries and the United States over its invasion of Ukraine. "GAIL doesn't see any problem in settling payment in euros," said one of the sources.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Women's feet smell 5 times worse than men's, claims P&G ad; firm issues apology
text: US consumer goods firm Procter & Gamble has apologised for a WeChat infographic that had the text: "Women's feet smell five times worse than men's. If you don't believe it, smell it." P&G removed the advertisement, which was meant to promote fragrant body care products, after backlash in China. "P&G always advocates equal, tolerant and respectful values," the company said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Who is Raj Subramaniam, the IITian named FedEx's new CEO?
text: Raj Subramaniam, who will be promoted as FedEx's CEO in June, is originally from Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram and currently lives in Memphis, Tennessee. The 56-year-old has a bachelor's degree in chemical engineering from IIT Bombay and an MBA from The University of Texas at Austin. Subramaniam joined FedEx in 1991 and is currently the firm's President and Chief Operating Officer.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Credit Suisse hasn't pursued new Russian clients since Feb: Reports
text: Credit Suisse has stopped pursuing new clients in Russia since the invasion of Ukraine on February 24, Reuters reported. Roughly 4% of the assets the bank manages belong to Russian clients, CEO Thomas Gottstein had said earlier. The bank has been striving to reduce its business contacts with Russia and helping clients limit their exposure to the country.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 37,000 feature phones users joined UPI service since March 8: Govt
text: Union Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Kishanrao Karad, in a written reply to Lok Sabha, said over 37,000 users have used digital payment services meant for feature phones, totalling 21,833 successful transactions since its launch on March 8. The UPI123 Pay service is meant for feature phones, which can be used by people without the internet.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: SMEs raised ₹932 crore via IPOs in FY22, 3.8 times more than FY21
text: A total of 67 small and medium enterprises (SMEs) raised ₹932 crore via IPOs in FY22, 3.8 times higher than the amount raised by SMEs in FY21, according to Prime Database. In FY21, 28 SMEs raised ₹244 crore via IPOs. The largest SME IPO in FY22 was of Gujarat-based Aashka Hospitals for ₹96 crore in September 2021.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Supertech homebuyers and creditors can file claims until April 8
text: Homebuyers and creditors that have invested in Supertech can submit their claims in the realty firm's insolvency case till April 8, Supertech's insolvency resolution professional said. Homebuyers need to submit documents like builder-buyer agreement and statement of accounts. By submitting their claims, homebuyers and creditors will become a part of the company's Committee of Creditors (COC).
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt's total liabilities in Q3 rise 2.15% QoQ to ₹128.4 lakh cr
text: The government's total liabilities rose 2.15% QoQ from ₹125.71 lakh crore in Q2 FY22 to ₹128.41 lakh crore in Q3. Data released by the Finance Ministry said public debt accounted for 91.6% of total outstanding liabilities in Q3, up from 91.15% in Q2. Commercial banks' share in the government's securities stood at 35.4% in Q3, down from 37.82% in Q2.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ONGC Videsh sells Russia's Sokol oil to BPCL, HPCL: Reports
text: Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) Videsh has sold at least one cargo of Russian Sokol oil to Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL), Reuters reported. This comes after the ONGC's overseas investment arm failed to draw interest in a tender earlier this month. ONGC Videsh has a stake in Russia's Sakhalin-1 project.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: SEBI directs Ruchi Soya to allow FPO investors to withdraw bids
text: Market regulator SEBI has directed Ruchi Soya Industries to allow investors who participated in its ₹4,300 crore follow-on public offering (FPO) to withdraw their bids from March 28-30. SEBI's directive came after "unsolicited SMSs advertising the issue" were sent to Patanjali users. The procedure to withdraw bids shall be informed to the investors via an advertisement, SEBI's order stated.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: What are the major announcements made in Delhi Budget 2022-23?
text: Presenting Delhi Budget 2022-23 of ₹75,800 crore, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said the government aims to generate 20 lakh more jobs in five years. Calling it 'Rozgar Budget', he added ₹800 crore will be allocated for creating jobs. The government will start 'Delhi Food Truck Policy' under which food trucks will operate from 8 pm to 2 am, Sisodia stated.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Which services are likely to be hit due to Bharat Bandh on March 28 & 29?
text: A joint forum of central trade unions, with support from All India Bank Employees Association, has called for Bharat Bandh on March 28 and 29 against the Central government's policies affecting workers. Workers from roadways, transport, electricity, railways, coal, steel, oil, telecom, insurance and postal sectors are likely to join the strike. SBI said its banking services may get affected.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 6th time in 7 days
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for sixth time in seven days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹99.41/litre after being increased by 30 paise/litre, while diesel price in Delhi has gone up to ₹90.77/litre from ₹90.42/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹114.19/litre from ₹113.88/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹98.50/litre from ₹98.13/litre.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 5th time in 6 days
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for fifth time in six days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹99.11/litre after being increased by 50 paise/litre, while diesel price in Delhi has gone up to ₹90.42/litre from ₹89.87/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹113.88/litre from ₹113.35/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹98.13/litre from ₹97.55/litre.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: PVR & INOX announce merger, combined entity to be called PVR INOX Limited
text: The Board of Directors of PVR Limited and INOX Leisure Limited on Sunday approved an all-stock amalgamation of the two brands. The combined entity will be known as PVR INOX Limited and the share exchange ratio will be three shares of PVR for 10 shares of INOX. The merger is yet to receive approvals from the respective shareholders and SEBI.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: My firm's executives are afraid to meet me personally: Sanctioned Russian oligarch
text: Russian oligarch Petr Aven, who was sanctioned by the EU and the UK, said the executives of the $22 billion investment firm he co-founded are scared to meet him personally after he stepped down. Aven told Financial Times that it's strange to be sanctioned just because you meet the President. "We try to be absolutely out of politics," he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Insurance firm removes its 'Z' logo from social media amid Russia-Ukraine war
text: Zurich Insurance has removed its 'Z' logo from social media after the letter became a symbol of support for Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The Swiss insurance company said it did not want to be misinterpreted as supporting Russia in the conflict. The letter 'Z' has been used as a marking on Russian military vehicles taking part in the conflict.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I'm not afraid of dying, it would come as a relief: World's richest person Musk
text: World's richest person Elon Musk said in an interview he would like to maintain his health for a longer period of time, but he's not afraid of dying. The 50-year-old added, "I think it would come as a relief." He further said he would like to live long enough to see the vision of his aerospace company SpaceX come true.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Let's make the local 'global': PM Modi on Indian exports
text: PM Narendra Modi in his 'Mann Ki Baat' radio programme on Sunday lauded India's achievement of the target of $400 billion in exports in FY2022. The PM said, "Let's make the local 'global' and augment the prestige of our products further." He added, "When every Indian is vocal for local, it doesn't take long for the local to become global."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: $400 billion exports record signifies India's potential, capabilities: PM Modi
text: During his 'Mann Ki Baat' address, PM Narendra Modi said India achieving its $400 billion exports target shows the demand for its items is increasing across the world. The PM added that the achievement signifies India's capabilities and potential. "When each and every Indian is vocal for local, it doesn't take long for the local to become global," he said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: What are the petrol prices in metro and other cities after 5th hike in 6 days?
text: Prices of petrol and diesel were hiked by oil marketing companies for the fifth time in six days on Sunday. Petrol price in Mumbai is the highest across metro cities, standing at ₹113.88 per litre. Petrol in the national capital today costs ₹99.11 per litre. On Tuesday, fuel prices were hiked for the first time in four months.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Prices of over 800 essential medicines set to increase by 10.7% from April
text: The prices of more than 800 essential medicines are expected to increase from April. Based on the WPI data, the prices will be hiked by 10.76607%, the National Pharmaceutical Pricing Authority (NPPA) said. The drugs included in the National List of Essential Medicines (NLEM) are used to treat fever, infections, anaemia, and hypertension and include commonly used medicines like paracetamol.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Users tweet videos of some McDonald's outlets still open in Russia
text: Several locals and news reports have claimed that some of the McDonald’s outlets are still operational in Russia. On March 8, McDonald's had announced that it would temporarily close its 850 outlets in Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. Some Russians also took to social media to share videos of the operational outlets. McDonald's hasn't commented on this as yet.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Biden to propose new 'billionaire's tax' in 2023 budget plan: Reports
text: US President Joe Biden is set to propose a tax aimed at billionaires as a part of his 2023 budget plans, claim several reports. The 'Billionaire Minimum Income Tax' would impose a minimum tax of 20% on those whose income is more than $100 million. Biden’s new tax could reportedly raise up to $360 billion in over 10 years.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Deutsche Bank fires top US bankers who sought reimbursement for strip club bill
text: Deutsche Bank fired four senior bankers in the US after the charges incurred at a strip club were expensed as legitimate business spending, Bloomberg reported. The executives had sought reimbursement for a restaurant visit and the bank fired them after discovering the issue. "We do not condone violations of our...company policy and take remedial action as appropriate," the bank said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: PVR, INOX Leisure shares hit 52-week high after announcing merger
text: Share prices of PVR and INOX Leisure hit a new 52-week high in Monday's intraday trade after the two companies announced a merger on Sunday. While INOX Leisure's share price touched ₹563.60, PVR shares jumped to ₹2,010.35. Notably, INOX will merge with PVR in a share swap ratio of three shares of PVR for every 10 shares of INOX.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Jeweller Joyalukkas files for ₹2,300 crore IPO
text: Jeweller Joyalukkas plans to raise up to ₹2,300 crore from an initial public offering (IPO), the company said in a draft prospectus. The proceeds will be used to pay back some loans and to open new stores, Joyalukkas said. Edelweiss Financial Services, Haitong Securities India, Motilal Oswal Investment Advisors and SBI Capital Markets are the lead managers to the issue.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: They're copycats, they've copied Patanjali: Ramdev on FMCG firms' natural products
text: Speaking about other FMCG companies launching natural products, Patanjali Founder Baba Ramdev alleged, "Everybody knows these companies are copycats. They've copied us." "Nobody can replicate our brand equity...A brand like Hindustan Unilever spent thousands of crores on Ayush but they didn't achieve anything," he said. Colgate Vedshakti's ingredient has "no use" in dental care, Ramdev claimed.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sanctioned Russian oligarch-backed VC fund takes down its website: Report
text: Impulse VC, a fund backed by sanctioned Russian billionaire oligarch Roman Abramovich, appears to have removed all information from its website, media reports said. The fund, which has offices in Russia and Germany, has wiped nearly every part of their website that identifies who they are. Its website was reportedly still operating on March 14, as per Wayback Machine.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Russia considers accepting Bitcoin for oil, gas exports from China, Turkey
text: Russia is considering accepting Bitcoin as payment for oil and gas exports from "friendly' nations like China and Turkey. Russia's head of energy committee Pavel Zavalny said "friendly" countries could be allowed to pay in Bitcoin or in their local currencies. Zavalny also said he supported Russian President Vladimir Putin's decision to sell natural gas to "unfriendly" nations in rubles.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: 28,684 micro enterprises grew into small businesses since 2020
text: Minister of State for MSMEs BPS Verma on Sunday said 28,684 micro enterprises and 3,679 small businesses registered on the Udyam portal have grown into small and medium-sized businesses respectively since July 2020. Data on medium enterprises growing into large businesses wasn't shared by Verma. As of March 27, of the 79.27 lakh registered MSMEs, 75.41 lakh were micro enterprises.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Yatra's Indian unit files for IPO, offer includes fresh issue of ₹750 crore
text: Online travel firm Yatra Online, Inc's Indian subsidiary has filed a draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with the SEBI for an initial public offering (IPO). The offer comprises a fresh issue of shares worth up to ₹750 crore and an offer for sale of up to 93.28 lakh shares. Yatra Online, Inc is listed on the American stock exchange Nasdaq.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices rising due to Russia-Ukraine war: Nitin Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Saturday said the petrol and diesel prices are increasing due to the Russia-Ukraine war. He said, "Amid the ongoing [Russia-Ukraine war], the oil prices have spiralled up within international markets...we cannot do anything about that." The fuel prices were hiked for the fourth time in five days on Saturday by around 80 paise per litre.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: FDI in India has broken records every year in last 7 years: Piyush Goyal
text: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday said foreign direct investment (FDI) in India in the last seven years "has consistently been growing and has broken all records year after year". He added that this shows India is emerging as a preferred destination for investment. "We had record investments in the COVID-19 period too," he said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India-UAE trade pact may come into force from May 1: Piyush Goyal
text: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday said the free trade agreement (FTA) between India and the UAE is likely to come into effect from May 1. Under the agreement, domestic exporters of 6,090 goods would get duty-free access to the UAE market, Goyal added. Overall, the UAE is offering duty elimination on over 97% of its products.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Adani Finserve, Tata AIG, 52 other firms bid for Reliance Capital: Reports
text: Adani Finserve, Tata AIG and ICICI Lombard are among 54 prominent companies that have expressed interest to acquire debt-ridden Reliance Capital Limited, PTI reported on Sunday. The company's board was superseded by RBI on November 29 in view of payment defaults and governance issues. The company had said in September 2021 that it had a consolidated debt of ₹40,000 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Vodafone Idea shareholders approve ₹14,500 crore fundraise proposal
text: Shareholders of Vodafone Idea (Vi) have approved a proposal to raise ₹14,500 crore, the telecom operator said in a filing on Saturday. Promoters Vodafone and Aditya Birla Group (ABG) plan to infuse up to ₹3,375 crore and ₹1,125 crore into Vi respectively. While Vodafone will subscribe to 75% or 253.75 crore equity shares, ABG will subscribe to 84.58 crore shares.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Anil Ambani steps down from board of Reliance Power & Reliance Infrastructure
text: Anil Ambani on Friday stepped down from the board of Reliance Infrastructure and Reliance Power. The development comes over a month after the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) restrained him from associating himself with any listed public company. He was also barred from the securities market for allegedly siphoning off funds from Reliance Home Finance Limited (RHFL).
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for fourth time in 5 days
text: The prices of petrol and diesel were hiked for the fourth time in five days on Saturday by around 80 paise per litre. Delhi will now be selling petrol at ₹98.61 per litre and diesel at ₹89.87 per litre, while in Mumbai, petrol prices have risen to ₹113.35 per litre, whereas diesel will now cost ₹97.55 per litre.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Indian Oil to raise petrol, diesel prices by 80 paise per litre from Friday
text: Indian Oil will raise prices of a litre of petrol and diesel by 80 paise from Friday, its third such increase this week, Reuters reported on Thursday citing a notification sent to fuel dealers. A litre of petrol will cost ₹97.81 while diesel will be sold at ₹89.07 in Delhi, the notification said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 3rd time in 4 days
text: Petrol and diesel prices were hiked for the third time in four days on Friday. The prices have been hiked by 80 paise/litre in Delhi. Petrol will cost ₹97.81/litre in the national capital, while diesel will cost ₹89.07/ litre. In Mumbai, petrol price has been increased by 84 paise/litre, taking the price to ₹112.51/litre.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Supertech declared insolvent, move may impact 25,000 homebuyers
text: Real estate developer Supertech, which has several ongoing projects in Noida, Gurugram and Ghaziabad, has gone into insolvency, Moneycontrol reported. On Friday, the National Company Law Tribunal ordered initiation of insolvency proceedings based on a petition filed by Union Bank of India for non-payment of dues. The order may impact over 25,000 buyers who were awaiting possession of their homes.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Mother of 3 makes jewellery out of breast milk, expects ₹15 crore turnover by 2023
text: London-based Safiyya Riyadh, a mother of three, and her husband Adam Riyadh run Magenta Flowers, which has expanded its business into breast milk jewellery. They convert milk into precious gems that can be worn as pendants and rings and expect a turnover of ₹15 crore by 2023. "It provides a sentimental connection between mothers and their babies," Safiyya said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I've nothing to do with it: UK FM on wife's stake in Infosys that operates in Russia
text: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak recently faced questions about his wife Akshata Murthy's stake in Infosys, which has a Russian presence. "I'm an elected politician and I'm here to talk...about what I'm responsible for. My wife isn't," he responded. When asked if Infosys is taking action against Putin's aggression, he said: "I've...no idea...I've nothing to do with that company."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: No active ties with local firms: Infosys as Rishi Sunak questioned over Russia link
text: Infosys has responded after company Co-founder Narayana Murthy's son-in-law and UK Finance Minister, Rishi Sunak, was questioned on TV about Infosys' presence in Russia. The Indian IT major said it "advocates for peace" between Russia and Ukraine. It added, "Infosys has a small team of employees based out of Russia...We don't have any active business relationships with local Russian enterprises."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I'm struggling to pay bills, don't know how to survive: Sanctioned Russian oligarch
text: Russian oligarch Petr Aven said he's struggling to pay bills after he was sanctioned by the European Union and the UK following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We don't understand how to survive...Our business is completely destroyed," Aven, whose wealth is estimated at $5.6 billion, told Financial Times. "Will I be allowed to have a cleaner, or a driver?" he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Does Twitter adhere to principle of free speech: Musk asks users in Twitter poll
text: World's richest person Elon Musk posted a Twitter poll asking users to vote if Twitter adheres to the principle of free speech. "Free speech is essential to a functioning democracy. Do you believe Twitter rigorously adheres to this principle?" Musk wrote, giving yes and no as options. "The consequences of this poll will be important. Please vote carefully," he warned.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: ICICI Bank users face glitches on net banking, mobile app; bank says 'working on it'
text: Several users of ICICI Bank took to Twitter on Friday to complain that they were facing glitches while using their net banking services and mobile app. "We're working to get things back to normal as quick as possible and will update you here," ICICI Direct said in a tweet. "This is not acceptable during market hours," a Twitter user wrote.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Apple pays another round of bonuses of ₹1.5 crore to some staff: Report
text: Apple has reportedly been paying a small number of engineers another round of bonuses in stock units ranging from $100,000 (₹76 lakh) to $200,000 (₹1.52 crore). The bonuses are designed to keep employees from leaving by vesting over several years, Bloomberg reported. The iPhone maker previously gave out stock-based bonuses of up to $180,000 in December.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ambani, 60 other tycoons invited to Yogi's swearing-in as UP CM: Report
text: Mukesh Ambani and 60 other business tycoons have been invited to watch Yogi Adityanath take oath as UP's CM for a second time, PTI reported on Thursday. Leading industrialists have been invited as they have a role in boosting the state's economy, former UP BJP chief Laxmikant Bajpai told ANI. Yogi will be sworn in as UP's CM on Friday.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Era of globalisation is over, we must prepare for a new era: Zoho CEO
text: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu, in response to a US author saying globalisation is over and suggesting the US should raise tariffs, said globalisation's era is "over" and that "we must prepare for a new era". "It was killed by...US dollar being an infinitely expanding reserve currency, which led to...US surrendering its industrial base, accompanied by...massive increase in inequality," Vembu added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Will consider if 'Nimbooz' is lemonade or fruit juice based drink: Supreme Court
text: The Supreme Court recently agreed to consider whether the product 'Nimbooz' can be classified under item 'lemonade' or as 'fruit pulp or fruit juice based drinks' for the purposes of determining the excise duty on the drink. This comes after an appeal from the company, Aradhana Foods, that demanded the drink be called 'lemonade' instead of its current categorisation.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: India to send 40,000 tonnes of diesel to crisis-hit Sri Lanka: Report
text: India has agreed to urgently provide a consignment of diesel to Sri Lanka as it faces a shortage amid an economic crisis. Indian Oil Corporation will reportedly send 40,000 tonnes of diesel to Sri Lanka soon. This is in addition to the seven monthly shipments of petrol and diesel being sent to Sri Lanka under a $500-million line of credit.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Petrol, diesel get costlier by ₹2.40 per litre in 4 days
text: Petrol and diesel have become costlier by around ₹2.40 per litre in just four days as state-run oil companies raised their rates by 80 paise a litre for the third time since March 22 on Friday. In Delhi, petrol prices have jumped by 2.5% since March 22 to ₹97.81 per litre. Fuel rates were unchanged from November 4, 2021-March 21.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Finance Bill, 2022 passed in Lok Sabha
text: The Lok Sabha on Friday passed the Finance Bill, 2022, completing the Budgetary exercise for the financial year 2022-23. The Bill was approved by Lower House after accepting 39 official amendments moved by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. The Bill proposed introduction of a new section to tax virtual digital assets (VDAs) and retrospective disallowance of deduction for surcharge or cess.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Future Enterprises defaults on ₹94 crore payment to banks, shares fall 5%
text: Future Enterprises has missed the due date of March 23, 2022, to pay ₹93.99 crore to Punjab National Bank and Canara Bank under the one-time restructuring (OTR) plan. Shares of Kishore Biyani-led company fell nearly 5% on Friday after the announcement. Future Enterprises informed the stock exchanges that it had a review period of 30 days to make the payment.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Air India may buy 30 large jets worth $10 billion: Rolls-Royce executive
text: Tata Group-owned Air India is looking to buy as many as 30 widebody aircraft worth $10 billion, said the Senior Vice President of Customers for Rolls-Royce Holdings in Asia Pacific. "I think they are looking at something up to 30 aircraft, could be as big as that, which is a big order. A really big order," Chris Davie told Bloomberg.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Emami acquires Dermicool powder brand from Reckitt for ₹432 crore
text: Emami on Friday announced that it has acquired the popular prickly heat powder brand Dermicool from FMCG major Reckitt Benckiser Group for a total consideration of ₹432 crore. The acquisition is funded through internal accruals and is subject to customary closing conditions, the company said. According to Emami, Dermicool commands 20% market share in the prickly heat powder category.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Why was realty developer Supertech declared bankrupt by NCLT?
text: India's bankruptcy court NCLT ordered insolvency proceedings against real estate firm Supertech over non-payment of around ₹432 crore in dues. The default involves a loan given by Union Bank of India to Eco Village II project at Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida, which was being developed for ₹1,106 crore. The bank moved NCLT in 2019 after Supertech failed to repay it.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Axis Bank fined ₹5 lakh by SEBI for violating merchant banking norms
text: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has imposed a ₹5 lakh fine on Axis Bank for violating merchant banking regulations. SEBI had conducted an examination into Debt Capital Market operations of Axis Bank between 2016-2019. It found that Axis Bank had acted as a merchant banker for 22 entities and acquired securities in nine issues without informing SEBI.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: IOC, BPCL, HPCL lost ₹17,000 cr in revenue in March due to fuel rate freeze: Moody's
text: Indian Oil Corporation, BPCL and HPCL have together lost around ₹17,000 crore in revenue in March by keeping fuel rates unchanged despite a sharp rise in global oil prices, Moody's Investors Service said. Indian retailers raised petrol prices on March 22, for the first time since November 4. Crude oil prices were averaging around $111 per barrel in early March.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 53rd Indian Handicrafts & Gifts Fair to be held in Gr Noida from Mar 30
text: The 53rd Indian Handicrafts and Gifts Fair will be held at India Expo Centre and Mart in Greater Noida from March 30-April 3. Reportedly, over 2,500 handicraft exhibitors from across the country will participate in the fair. EPCH Chairman Raj Kumar Malhotra said the exhibitors will showcase over 2,000 new products across 14 product categories like houseware, furniture, decoratives, etc.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: UN cuts India's GDP growth forecast for FY22 from 6.7% to 4.6%
text: India's projected GDP growth for FY22 has been downgraded from 6.7% to 4.6%, a United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) report said. Citing the Ukraine war for the cut in forecast, it added that India is expected to face reflexes from trade sanctions, food inflation and financial instability. It also said Russia will experience deep recession this year.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Delhi court dismisses ex-NSE official Anand Subramanian's bail plea
text: A Delhi Court on Thursday dismissed former National Stock Exchange (NSE) Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian's bail plea. Subramanian is accused of being the 'Himalayan yogi' in the co-location scam case including former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna. "There are strong chances that [Subramanian] may influence the relevant witnesses or tamper with the evidence," the court said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: IGL hikes price of CNG and PNG by ₹1 per unit in Delhi-NCR
text: Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) has hiked the price of compressed natural gas (CNG) and domestic piped natural gas (PNG) in Delhi-NCR by ₹1/unit. The new prices will come into effect from today. CNG now costs ₹59.01/kg in Delhi, ₹61.58/kg in Noida and ₹67.37/kg in Gurugram. PNG costs ₹36.61/standard cubic meter (SCM) in Delhi, ₹35.86/SCM in Noida and ₹34.81/SCM in Gurugram.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: India's exports hit $400 billion for 1st time ever, PM Modi calls it 'key milestone'
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday said that India has achieved an ambitious target of $400 billion worth of goods exports for the first time ever, nine days ahead of schedule. "I congratulate our farmers, weavers, MSMEs, manufacturers, exporters for this success," he tweeted. "This is a key milestone in our Aatmanirbhar Bharat journey," the PM added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Goldman Sachs CEO, who's also a DJ, to perform at Lollapalooza music festival
text: Goldman Sachs' 60-year-old CEO David Solomon, who's also a DJ, is set to perform at Chicago's Lollapalooza music festival in July. Besides Solomon, artists like Dua Lipa, Machine Gun Kelly, Doja Cat, and bands like Green Day and Metallica are set to perform at the music festival. Previously, Solomon also did a cameo on the Showtime series 'Billions'.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I want one: Mahindra as man builds wooden treadmill that works without power
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra shared the video of a man who built a wooden treadmill that works without power and wrote on Twitter, "I want one." "In a world of...energy-hungry devices...the hours of dedicated efforts in hand-making this device makes it a work of art, not just a treadmill," he added. Telangana's IT Minister KT Rama Rao also lauded his work.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Indian Oil Corporation buys another 3 million barrels of Russian Urals oil: Report
text: Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) has reportedly bought 3 million barrels of Russian Urals oil and 2 million barrels of West African oil through a tender for May loading. It purchased the Urals crude from Geneva-based trader Vitol on delivered basis at a "discount", Reuters reported citing sources. Earlier this month, IOC bought similar volumes of Urals from Vitol.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Musk dances in front of drone at Tesla's German factory; new video surfaces
text: A new video has surfaced on social media, showing Tesla CEO Elon Musk dancing in front of a drone capturing the opening of Tesla's Germany plant. Musk was cheered as he oversaw the handover of Tesla's first German-made cars at its Grünheide plant. It marked the start of Tesla's inaugural European hub just two years after it was first announced.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Being rich won't change me: CEO as he turns billionaire after 10,000% stock surge
text: Otto Toto Sugiri, the 68-year-old Founder-CEO of data centre providing company PT DCI Indonesia, is worth $2.5 billion as his company's shares shot up over 10,000% since listing, Bloomberg reported. "Being rich won't change me," said Otto, who keeps his hair long and has a preference for black tops. He began his career as an IT programmer in Germany.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Paytm shares surge up to 13%, post biggest gain in 4 months
text: The shares of Paytm parent One97 Communications surged as much as 13% on Thursday, its maximum gains since November 24, 2021. The stock hit an intraday high of ₹592.40 per share, before paring some of its gains. The stock had fallen over 70% below its IPO price of ₹2,150 in the months following its listing.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Bezos' ex-wife donates $3.8 bn to 465 non-profit entities in 9 months
text: Philanthropist MacKenzie Scott, who divorced Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos in 2019, said she has donated over $3.8 billion to 465 non-profit organisations since last June. She has donated $275 million to US-based Planned Parenthood, the largest donation from a single donor in the organisation's history. The donation is part of Scott's pledge to give away the majority of her wealth.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: It's a routine inquiry: Hero MotoCorp on tax raids at offices, Pawan Munjal's home
text: After reports said that Income Tax department raided Hero MotoCorp's offices and Chairman and MD Pawan Munjal's residence, the company said the officials' visit was part of a "routine inquiry". "This is not uncommon before the end of the financial year. We assure all our stakeholders that it continues to be business as usual," Hero MotoCorp added in a statement.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India's urban unemployment rate fell to 9.8% in July-Sept 2021 after 2nd wave
text: India's urban unemployment rate fell to 9.8% in July-September 2021 from 12.6% in the previous quarter as cases declined following the second COVID-19 wave, as per data released by the government. Female urban unemployment rate was lower after the second wave than before it, standing at 11.6% in July-September 2021 as against 11.8% in January-March 2021, data showed.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India exports $46 million worth of goods every hour in 2021-22; PM shares data
text: As India's exports hit $400 billion in 2021-22 for the first time ever, PM Modi shared data on Twitter which showed that $46 million worth of goods were exported every hour on an average. Around $1 billion worth of exports were done every day and $33 billion every month. India achieved its $400-billion exports target nine days ahead of schedule.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Which are the world's 10 richest nations in terms of privately-held wealth?
text: The US is the wealthiest country in terms of private wealth held by all its individuals ($68.8 trillion), as per a report by Henley & Partners. It is followed by China with $23.3 trillion privately-held wealth and Japan with $20.1 trillion. India and Germany stand fourth and fifth with around $8.9 trillion each, while the UK ($8.8 trillion) stands sixth.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Milk powder costs 790 Sri Lankan rupees, rice at 290/kg amid Lankan economic crisis
text: The prices of essential commodities like rice and milk have surged sharply in Sri Lanka amid an acute shortage caused by the country's ongoing economic crisis. According to an activist based in Mannar, 400 grams of milk powder now costs 790 Sri Lankan rupees, while rice and sugar prices have surged to 290 Sri Lankan rupees per kg each.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt puts plan to let local companies list overseas on hold: Report
text: The government has frozen plans to allow local firms to list overseas, Reuters reported. The plan has been put on hold as India believes there's enough depth in local capital markets for firms to raise funds and get good valuations, Reuters added. Over 60 companies made their market debut in India in 2021 and raised over $13.7 billion.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I'm impressed: World's 5th richest man Buffett to businessman Mohnish Pabrai
text: World's fifth-richest man Warren Buffett, Chairman of Berkshire Hathaway, praised Indian-American businessman Mohnish Pabrai for the work at his Dakshana Foundation, which helps poor students prepare for IIT and medical entrance exams. "I remain incredibly impressed by what you've done, are doing and will do at Dakshana," Buffett wrote to Pabrai. In its annual report, Dakshana had quoted Buffett.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Zee's largest shareholder withdraws EGM notice for Goenka's removal, shares jump 17%
text: Zee Entertainment's largest shareholder Invesco Developing Markets Fund has withdrawn its requisition notice for an extraordinary general meeting to remove MD and CEO Punit Goenka as a director. Invesco, which together with its subsidiary OFI Global China Fund holds 17.88% stake in Zee Entertainment, also backed the Zee merger with Sony India. Zee's shares jumped around 17% after the news.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Harsh Goenka shares a list of 'biggest career mistakes'; Twitter users react
text: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka tweeted a list of eight "biggest career mistakes", including "thinking that you know everything" and "not having a mentor". Twitter users reacted to Goenka's tweet, with tweets like, "Excellent suggestions" and "Most sound and practical advice." A user also argued, "I don't see why 5 is an issue...Why take on unnecessary stress...to pursue a promotion?"
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Meet Khrisha, the daughter we've always wanted: Tina Ambani on Anmol-Khrisha's pics
text: Tina Ambani, former actress and businessman Anil Ambani's wife, took to Instagram to share some pictures from her son Anmol Ambani and Khrisha's wedding reception. "Meet Khrisha Ambani, the daughter we've always wanted. Our family grows more beautiful, our lives are fuller, more blessed," she captioned the pictures. Anmol Ambani and Khrisha got married in February this year.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sanctions on Russian oil, gas will collapse global energy market: Novak
text: Russian Deputy PM Alexander Novak has said that global energy markets would collapse if sanctions were imposed on oil and gas from Russia. He said there was a shortage of crude in global markets of about one million barrels per day. This comes as the US and UK have taken steps to ban Russian oil imports amid the Ukraine's invasion.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Sanctions on Russia may cause impairment losses for ONGC: Moody's
text: Sanctions imposed on Russia may lead to impairment of value of investments made by Indian companies in Russia's oil and gas fields, Moody's said on Thursday. The investors include Oil and Natural Gas Corporation of India (ONGC), Oil India, Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum Corporation. Indian firms have invested $16 billion in Russian assets.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Britain imposes new sanctions on Russian elites and businesses
text: Britain has imposed new sanctions on Russian banks with total assets of £500 billion and oligarchs and family members with a net worth of over £150 billion. The sanctions target strategic industries including a defence company that makes drones and top lender Gazprombank. Sanctions have also been imposed on Sberbank CEO Herman Gref, among others.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: US' Hertz that ordered 1 lakh Teslas adds Model Y to its EV fleet
text: American car rental company Hertz, which had ordered one lakh Tesla vehicles last year, has added Tesla's electric mid-size SUV Model Y to its electric vehicle fleet. Last year, the deal announcement had generated a $119 billion jump in market value for both the firms combined. Tesla added $118 billion, taking its total market value to over $1 trillion.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Maruti Suzuki appoints Hisashi Takeuchi as MD and CEO for next 3 years
text: Japanese automaker Maruti Suzuki has appointed Hisashi Takeuchi as the company's MD and CEO till March 31, 2025. Kenichi Ayukawa, the MD since 2013, will be the whole-time Director for the next six months to help in the transition. Takeuchi joined the Suzuki Motor Corporation in 1986 and has been Joint MD at Maruti Suzuki India since April 2021.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Mumbai has costliest petrol among metro cities at ₹111.67/litre
text: After nearly four months of being stable, petrol and diesel prices were hiked for a second straight day on Wednesday, making a litre of petrol costliest in Mumbai as compared to other metro cities. As per Indian Oil Corporation, a litre of petrol costs ₹111.67 in Mumbai and a litre of diesel costs ₹95.85.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Hyd to have Qualcomm's 2nd biggest campus, to employ 8,700 people
text: Qualcomm will invest ₹3,904.55 crore to expand their operations in Hyderabad and are planning to inaugurate their second-largest campus outside the US in the city by October 2022, according to reports. This investment would be made over a period of five years and will lead to an employment generation for about 8,700 software professionals, reports added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: 150 Amrapali units in stalled projects sold for ₹70 crore in last 1 month
text: ANAROCK Group has sold 150 units in stalled projects of Amrapali Group for approximately ₹70 crore within just 30 days. ANAROCK is the exclusive partner for the sale of over 5,000 unsold homes of Amrapali's stalled projects. Over 46,000 units in 23 stalled Amrapali projects will be delivered in tranches by June 2024, said NBCC CMD PK Gupta.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices raised by 80 paise per litre after a gap of over 4 months
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been increased by 80 paise per litre for the first time in over four months. The rate of petrol in the country's capital Delhi is ₹96.21 per litre today while that of diesel is ₹87.47 per litre. In Mumbai, the petrol and diesel prices have increased to ₹110.82 per litre and ₹95.00 per litre respectively.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for the 2nd day in a row
text: Petrol and diesel prices were hiked by over 80 paise each for the second consecutive day on Wednesday. The latest hike takes petrol price in Delhi to ₹97.01 per litre and diesel to ₹88.27. In Mumbai, petrol now costs ₹111.67/litre, while diesel costs ₹95.85. On Tuesday, the rates were hiked for the first time after a gap of four months.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Domestic LPG cylinder price hiked by ₹50 for 1st time since October
text: The price of a domestic LPG cylinder has been increased by around ₹50 in Delhi, Mumbai and other cities, the first hike since October 6, 2021. A 14.2 kg cylinder now costs ₹949.50 in Delhi and Mumbai as against ₹899.50 earlier, while in Kolkata, it costs ₹976. On Tuesday, petrol price was also hiked for the first time since November.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Assets worth ₹19,000 cr belonging to Mallya, Nirav Modi & Choksi seized: Govt
text: The Centre has informed the Parliament that it has so far seized assets worth ₹19,111 crore, belonging to fugitives Vijay Mallya, Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi. It further said that the three of them have defrauded public sector banks to the tune of ₹22,585.83 crore. It added that assets worth ₹15,113.91 crore have been restored to the public sector banks.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Employees' PF interest rate cut reflects today's realities: Nirmala Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman spoke about the lowering of interest on the Employees' Provident Fund from 8.5% to 8.1% for 2021-22. She said, "EPFO's central board has representatives from different stakeholders who have taken this call...It had been 40 years since the rate wasn't brought down." She added, "There are today's realities that keep us in context with the decisions."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Which are the highest revenue-generating football clubs as per Deloitte Money League?
text: Manchester City have topped the Deloitte Football Money League for the first time as the world's highest revenue-generating club in 2020-21 season. Manchester City topped the list with €644.9-million revenue. They were followed by Real Madrid (€640.7 million) and Bayern Munich (€611.4 million). Barcelona dropped three places to be ranked fourth on the list with €582.1-million revenue.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Elon Musk dances at the opening of Tesla's German factory; video surfaces
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk was seen dancing in a video after delivering Tesla's first German-made cars to 30 clients and their families at the company's Grünheide plant on Tuesday. The deliveries marked the start of Tesla's inaugural European hub just two years after it was first announced. "This is a great day for the factory," Musk said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Fundamentals remain robust: Paytm as BSE seeks clarity on stock price fall
text:
A day after BSE sought clarification from Paytm parent One97 Communications over a sharp plunge in its stock price, the company said its "business fundamentals remain robust" as demonstrated in previous earnings. "There is no information...which...may have a bearing
on the price/volume behaviour in the scrip of the company," it added. Paytm's shares fell to a record low on Tuesday.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Hero MotoCorp MD Pawan Munjal's office, residence raided by I-T dept: Reports
text: The Income Tax (I-T) department on Wednesday conducted searches at Hero MotoCorp Chairman and MD Pawan Munjal's office and residence, according to reports. The raids were reportedly being conducted at over two dozen premises linked to India's largest two-wheeler maker. The premises included those of several senior officials of the company in Delhi, Gurugram and other cities, reports said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: BSE seeks clarification from Paytm's parent company over fall in share price
text: The BSE has sought a clarification from Paytm's parent company One 97 Communications Ltd over a fall in its share price. It said the clarification is sought to ensure that investors "have latest relevant information about the company and to inform the market". While the issue price of Paytm shares was ₹2,150, the price dropped to ₹543.90 in Tuesday's trade.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Crypto mining cost not to be allowed as deduction under Income Tax Act: Govt
text: The infrastructure cost incurred in the mining of cryptocurrencies or any Virtual Digital Assets (VDA) won't be allowed as a deduction under the Income Tax Act, MoS for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said. He said the government will come out with a definition of VDA with a view to levy 30% tax on income from the transfer of such assets.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I-T dept raids Hiranandani Group at 24 places in Mumbai, B'luru & Chennai
text: The Income Tax department on Tuesday conducted raids on several premises linked to Hiranandani Group over suspected tax evasion. The raids were underway at around 24 locations in Mumbai, Chennai and Bengaluru, including residences of some top officials, department officials said. The group, founded by Niranjan and Surendra Hiranandani in 1978, is one of India's largest real estate companies.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ambani's Jio World Centre in Mumbai gets armed CISF cover: Report
text: The Union government has sanctioned armed security cover of over 200 CISF personnel to guard the Jio World Centre opened by Reliance Industries in Mumbai, PTI reported. The business and entertainment centre, spread across 18.5 acres in Bandra Kurla Complex, will receive counter-terrorist cover. Mukesh Ambani and Nita Ambani are protectees of the CRPF VIP security wing.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: His dignity is humbling: Mahindra on 125-yr-old Padma Shri awardee Swami Sivananda
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra shared a video of UP-based yoga guru Swami Sivananda receiving the Padma Shri award and wrote, "The power of yoga. A life spanning 125 years of dedication." "The grace and dignity of...Sivananda is both humbling & inspiring. Proud to belong to the country of yoga's origin," he tweeted. Sivananda knelt before PM Narendra Modi at the ceremony.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: HUL in talks to buy majority stake in MDH at ₹10,000 crore-₹15,000 crore valuation: Report
text: FMCG major Hindustan Unilever Ltd is in discussions to buy a majority stake in MDH Spices, Livemint reported on Tuesday. MDH could be valued between ₹10,000 crore and ₹15,000 crore, the report added. MDH Spices is said to have been in discussions with other conglomerates too after the demise of Founder Mahashay Dharampal Gulati, who passed away in December 2020.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Burger King UK accuses McDonald's of copying its food item; shares meme
text: Burger King UK has accused McDonald's of copying one of its food items as the latter recently shared new additions to its menu. Burger King accused McDonald's of copying its Chilli Cheese Bites and shared a meme on Facebook, which read, "Can I copy your homework?" Burger King claims it has been serving the item for the last 15 years.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Spent sleepless nights over ₹16 lakh down payment: Anil Agarwal on buying his 1st firm
text: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal on Monday shared how he acquired a bankrupt company named Shamsher Sterling Cable Company in May 1976. "I had no experience on how to buy a company, but I went ahead anyway," he wrote. Agarwal revealed that he "spent many sleepless nights thinking" about the down payment but managed to gather ₹16 lakh through loans.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensodyne asked to discontinue misleading ads, fined ₹10 lakh
text: The Central Consumer Protection Authority has imposed a ₹10 lakh fine on Sensodyne while ordering it to discontinue certain misleading advertisements within seven days. Ads that claimed Sensodyne as 'Recommended by dentists worldwide' and 'World's No.1 sensitivity toothpaste' have been ordered to be stopped. Earlier, Sensodyne was asked to stop ads that showed endorsement by foreign dentists.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Indian billionaire Ravi Pillai buys helicopter costing ₹100 crore
text: Dubai-based Indian billionaire Ravi Pillai, the Chairman of industrial development conglomerate RP Group, has bought an Airbus H145 helicopter costing ₹100 crore. The helicopter was delivered by Airbus in Kovalam and took its inaugural flight from Kovalam to The Raviz Ashtamudi. The helicopter is capable of landing and takeoff from even high altitudes of 20,000 feet above sea level.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Growth impact of Ukraine crisis should be marginal for India: RBI Governor
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor, Shaktikanta Das, on Monday said the growth impact of the Russia-Ukraine crisis should be marginal for India. He further said he does not see a situation in India where inflation remains above the 2% to 6% band for extended period. Das was addressing industrialists at the National Council Meeting of the CII.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: US lawmakers raise concerns around Musk's business in China: WSJ
text: Some US lawmakers have raised concerns over Elon Musk-owned SpaceX's ties in China, questioning if Beijing could exploit the ties to gain access to classified information through its foreign suppliers, the WSJ reported. Utah's Representative Chris Stewart reportedly said, "I am a fan of Elon Musk...but anyone would be concerned if there are financial entanglements with China."
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Jack Ma-led Alibaba increases share buyback size to record $25 bn
text: Billionaire Jack Ma-led Alibaba has increased its share buyback programme to $25 billion, the largest ever repurchase plan by the e-commerce firm. In August, Alibaba had increased the programme from $10 billion to $15 billion. The firm's board has approved the programme, which will run through March 2024. Alibaba's shares rose 4.8% in Hong Kong following the news.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Indian economy better placed to deal with challenges: RBI Governor
text: Governor of the Reserve Bank of India, Shaktikanta Das on Monday said that the Indian economy is "comfortably placed to deal with any challenges with regard to financing the Current Account Deficit (CAD)". He also said that the RBI will continue to ensure liquidity to support the economy, which is facing some troubles following the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Delhi NCR developers plan to halt construction as raw material costs soar
text: Developers in Delhi NCR are planning to stop purchase of raw materials and construction activity due to rising raw material costs, according to industry body CREDAI NCR. "After COVID-19, the current crisis is a dual blow on real estate developers," said CREDAI NCR President Pankaj Bajaj. CREDAI members in Maharashtra are also planning to stop work for the same reason.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt's PLI scheme not leading us towards closed economy: NITI Aayog VC
text: Centre's Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme for Aatmanirbhar India is not leading us towards a closed economy, NITI Aayog Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar said. He added that India remains deeply committed to greater integration with global flows and the regional network. Inviting investments from Japan, he said, "Japanese companies are very well placed to [help us] achieve [these goals]."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Cost of EVs to be at par with petrol-run vehicles in 2 years: Gadkari
text: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said cost of electric vehicles (EVs) will be at par with cost of petrol-run vehicles in two years. Emphasising on the need to shift to a cost-effective indigenous fuel, Gadkari said rapid strides in technology and green fuel will reduce EV costs. Cost of driving EVs will be about 1/10th of petrol vehicles, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Campus Activewear gets SEBI's nod for IPO launch
text: Footwear brand Campus Activewear has received market regulator SEBI's approval for an IPO launch. Promoters Hari Krishan Agarwal and Nikhil Aggarwal will cumulatively sell 1.4 crore shares of the 5.1 crore shares that will be offered for sale by promoters and investors. The money raised will go to the shareholders and the company will not receive any of the funds.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Suzuki to invest ₹10,440 cr to make electric vehicles, batteries in Gujarat
text: Japan's Suzuki Motor Corporation has announced plans to invest around ₹10,440 crore to locally manufacture electric vehicles (BEV) and BEV batteries in Gujarat. The memorandum of understanding was signed at India-Japan Economic Forum in the presence of PM Narendra Modi and Japanese PM Fumio Kishida. "We'll continue active investment in India to realise Atmanirbhar Bharat," Suzuki's President said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ₹224 cr undisclosed income found during raids on Maharashtra-based unicorn
text: The Income Tax department found an undisclosed income of about ₹224 crore after it raided a unicorn startup based in Pune and Thane in Maharashtra. While the firm is engaged in wholesale and retail of construction materials, the Central Board of Direct Taxes said that its annual turnover exceeded ₹6,000 crore. Unaccounted cash worth ₹1 crore has also been seized.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Reliance Retail acquires 89% stake in women's innerwear brand Clovia
text: Reliance Retail Ventures Limited (RRVL) has acquired an 89% equity stake in Purple Panda Fashions Private Limited, which owns and operates Clovia, a brand for women's innerwear and loungewear. Reliance made an investment of ₹950 crore through a combination of secondary stake purchase and primary investment. Clovia was launched in 2013 by Pankaj Vermani, Neha Kant and Suman Chowdhury.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Govt working on classification of cryptos under GST law: Report
text: The government is reportedly working on the classification of cryptocurrencies as goods or services under the GST law. "There's a clarity needed in regard to levy of GST on cryptocurrencies and whether it has to be levied on the entire value," an official told PTI. Currently, the government levies 18% GST on the services provided by the crypto exchanges.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Apple ex-employee charged with defrauding company out of $10 mn in US
text: Dhirendra Prasad, a former Apple employee, has been charged with defrauding the tech giant out of more than $10 million in the US. The 52-year-old worked for 10 years as a buyer in Apple's Global Service Supply Chain department. According to the federal prosecutors, Prasad exploited his position to defraud Apple by allegedly taking kickbacks, stealing equipment and laundering money.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Loss in one crypto can't be set off against income in another one: Govt
text: Loss from the transfer of a virtual digital asset (VDA) will not be allowed to set off against income arising from transfer of another VDA, the Minister of State for Finance, Pankaj Chaudhary, told the Lok Sabha on Monday. He also clarified that infrastructure costs incurred in crypto mining won't be treated as cost of acquisition, but as capital expenditure.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Cooperating with authorities: Infra.Market after ₹224 cr undisclosed income detected
text: Infra.Market Founder Souvik Sengupta on Sunday said that they are cooperating with the authorities to provide them with the necessary information to solve the issues they have in relation to the recent searches. The Income Tax department has found an undisclosed income of ₹224 crore from the Maharashtra-based unicorn startup group and has seized unaccounted cash worth ₹1 crore.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: No fears of 'stagflation' in India: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "With regard to the prospect of stagflation, whether it is a risk for India, in our assessment I think such prospects don't exist." He added, "India is far away from such a grim prospect." 'Stagflation' is when there's slow economic growth and relatively high unemployment, which is at the same time accompanied by rising prices.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: He is Aatmanirbhar: Anand Mahindra on 19-year-old's midnight run in Noida
text: Sharing the viral video of a 19-year-old man running in Noida at midnight, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra said, "He is Aatmanirbhar!" While he refused a lift offered by filmmaker Vinod Kapri, Mahindra wrote, "This is indeed inspiring. But you know what my Monday Motivation is? The fact that he is so independent and refuses the offer of a ride."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: India's crude oil imports from Russia are minuscule: Petroleum Minister
text: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas, Hardeep Singh Puri, on Monday addressed the impact of Russia-Ukraine conflict on the import of crude oil and said that India's oil imports from Russia are "minuscule". He told the Rajya Sabha, "We require a total of 5 million barrels per day. That's our (crude oil) consumption...60% of it comes from the Gulf."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: US toy company raises money for Ukraine with Zelenskyy's 'Lego' figures
text: A Chicago artist has designed a Lego-style figurine of the Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a bid to raise money for Ukraine. Joe Trupia, the owner of Citizen Brick, a toy manufacturing company, has no personal connections to the war but felt compelled to help. Citizen Brick has raised over $145,000 and donated it to a charity organisation helping Ukraine.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Condom sales surge in Russia amid Western sanctions & fear of shortage
text: Amid Western sanctions and fear of shortage, sales for condoms have surged in Russia. The country’s largest online retailer Wildberries saw condom sales surging 170% in the first two weeks of March as compared with last year. Pharmacy chain 36.6 also reported a 26% jump in its sales. Meanwhile, a government official said a shortage of this product isn't expected.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: China Eastern to ground all its Boeing 737-800 jets after recent crash: Report
text: After China Eastern Airlines Boeing 737- 800 with 132 people on board crashed on Monday, the airline has grounded all of its Boeing 737-800 passenger flights from Tuesday, reported Chinese media. China Eastern reportedly has 109 of the 737-800s in its fleet. China's airline industry has a good safety record, with its last major accident taking place 12 years ago.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: US is offering rewards of up to $5 million for info on Russian oligarchs' assets
text: The US government is offering rewards of up to $5 million for anyone who can provide information leading to the seizure of assets belonging to Russian oligarchs. Under the program, assets can include yachts, jets, and properties situated in the US. The government has also provided names of 28 Russians, for which they are interested in receiving information.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Jhunjhunwala purchased 12 apartments for ₹371 crore to build his new home: Report
text: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala bought 12 apartments in Ridgeway Apartments Malabar Hill to build his new multi-storey home currently being built in Mumbai, Moneycontrol reported. He paid ₹176 crore in 2013 for the first six apartments and ₹195 crore in 2017 for the next six. Jhunjhunwala's new home will spread across 70,000 square feet and will also have a banquet hall.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Jhunjhunwala's multi-storey mansion to have living room larger than 3BHK: Report
text: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's 70,000 sq ft multi-storey Mumbai residence will have living and dining rooms larger than the size of 3BHK apartments in luxury projects, Moneycontrol reported. "His master bedroom of 731 square feet is 20% bigger than the average 2BHK," it added. The 4th floor will have a banquet hall and the 10th floor will have four guest bedrooms.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Elon Musk among witnesses in Johnny Depp & Amber Heard's court case
text: World's richest person Elon Musk has been included in list of witnesses slated to testify in a defamation lawsuit filed by Johnny Depp against his ex-wife Amber Heard. Depp has alleged that Heard had an extra-marital affair with Musk and James Franco while they were married. Both Musk and Franco are scheduled to testify virtually during the trial next month.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: PayPal expands services for Ukrainian users, waives transaction fees
text: PayPal said it is expanding services in Ukraine and Ukrainians will now be able to send and receive money from friends and family. Earlier, PayPal users in Ukraine could only send money internationally from their accounts and not receive it. PayPal is also waiving transaction fees for remittances to Ukrainian accounts.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Sanctions on Russia are like weapons of mass destruction: Raghuram Rajan
text: Sanctions imposed on Russia in the wake of the Russia-Ukraine war are like "weapons of mass destruction", former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said. "They may not topple buildings or collapse bridges but they destroy firms, financial institutions, livelihoods, and even lives," Rajan said. If not governed properly, sanctions could disturb the global financial order, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: No proposal from RBI on crypto trading mechanism yet: Govt
text: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary on Monday said the RBI has not yet proposed any mechanism for the trading of crypto assets. He said the cryptocurrency sector's legal framework "may be finalised only after all aspects are carefully examined". Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman had earlier proposed a 30% tax on income earned from crypto transactions in Budget 2022.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Renault resumes production at Moscow plant
text: French automobile manufacturer Renault has resumed production at its plant in Moscow. Renault suspended operations at its car assembly plant in Moscow in late February due to logistics bottlenecks that caused component shortages. According to ratings agency Fitch, Renault generated 10% of its revenue and around 12% of its operating profit margin in the country in 2021.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Working for Jeff Bezos was relentless, unforgiving: Former assistant
text: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' former executive assistant Ann Hiatt said working for Bezos was "relentless" and the environment could be "unforgiving". She told Insider, "In a single word (relentless), is who he is and who he wants his employees and...company to be." Notably, Bezos initially thought of naming the e-commerce giant 'Relentless.com' and the domain still leads to Amazon's website.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt plans to merge BBNL and BSNL this month: BSNL chief
text: Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) Chairman and MD PK Purwar said the government has decided to merge BSNL and Bharat Broadband Nigam Limited (BBNL) this month. He added that the government has given BSNL an opportunity to turnaround their losses. With the proposed merger, BSNL will get 5.67 lakh kilometre of optical fibre network laid across 1.85 lakh village panchayats.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Working to improve tax literacy & number of taxpayers: CBDT chief
text: CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra said the Income Tax department is working to improve the "abysmally poor" tax literacy in the country to increase the number of taxpaying entities and enhance collections. "Banks have invested in expanding the banking knowledge of the people. That thing has not happened in (income) tax and that is on top of our mind," he said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Saudi Aramco's net profit more than doubles to $110 billion in 2021
text: Oil giant Saudi Aramco on Sunday reported that its annual net profit for 2021 has more than doubled amid soaring crude oil prices. Aramco said its net profit increased by 124% to $110 billion in 2021, compared to $49 billion in 2020. The company has further announced that it plans to boost its capital expenditure to $40-$50 billion this year.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: LIC files updated IPO prospectus with Q3 results: Reports
text: LIC has filed an updated draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with market regulator SEBI for its upcoming IPO, PTI reported. The updated DRHP includes LIC's Q3 FY22 financials. LIC had earlier filed its draft papers with SEBI in February. According to reports, the LIC IPO, earlier scheduled for March, was postponed to mid-May due to rising market volatility.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Appalling and awful: UK FM on ferry firm firing 800 staff over Zoom
text: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak said the way that P&O Ferries has treated its workers is appalling and awful. The UK-based ferry company last week fired 800 employees without any warning over a Zoom video. According to a report by Sunday Times, several government ministers were aware of the company's plans to fire employees before P&O Ferries' staff was informed.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: What could become costlier in India due to the war in Ukraine?
text: Global prices of commodities and fuel have soared to unprecedented levels amid the war in Ukraine. Edible oil, food grains, corn could become costlier in India due to the war. Rare metals such as nickel, platinum, palladium, and gold could become costlier as Russia is one of the biggest exporters, and sanctions have stopped the metals from reaching global market.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Indian firms may replace Western pharma companies leaving Russian market: Russia
text: Indian firms may replace Western pharmaceutical companies leaving the Russian market over Ukraine war, Russian envoy to India Denis Alipov told the Rossiya 24 broadcaster. The newly appointed Russian envoy added that India is a "world pharmacy". Earlier this month, Alipov had said that Moscow welcomed the independent foreign policy of India amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Russia's richest man's property worth $116 million seized by Italy
text: Italian authorities have seized a building complex owned by Russian businessman Alexei Mordashov, Prime Minister Mario Draghi's office announced. The property is located on the Mediterranean island of Sardinia and is worth around $116 million. Earlier this month, a 215-foot yacht worth more than $71 million, called the "Lady M", belonging to Russia's richest man Mordashov was impounded in Italy.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Ukrainian CEO featured in Forbes' rich list stays behind in Kharkiv to help rescuers
text: A Ukrainian businessman, ranked among wealthiest Ukrainians, chose to stay back in Kharkiv to help local defenders and rescuers, a media report said. Vsevolod Kozhemyaka, CEO of Agrotrade Group, has been posting images and videos related to attacks on Kharkiv on Instagram. He was on the 88th spot in Forbes' list of 100 richest people in Ukraine in 2020.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Want to shut all 800 restaurants but our Russian partner refused: Burger King owner
text: Restaurant Brands International, the parent company of Burger King, said it wants to immediately shut all its 800 restaurants in Russia but its Russian joint venture partner has "refused" to do so.  "We can't unilaterally suspend operations" because it's a "complicated legal process", it added. Earlier, the company suspended corporate support for Russian locations amid Ukraine's invasion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russian fast-food chain reveals logo nearly identical to McDonald's
text: A Russian fast-food chain called Uncle Vanya has filed to trademark a logo that looks nearly identical to Golden Arches of McDonald's. The logo that shows the Cyrillic letter 'Ve', representing 'V' in Vanya, also uses the red and yellow colour scheme associated with McDonald's. After McDonald's shut 850 restaurants, Russia's State Duma suggested replacing it with Uncle Vanya.
author: Kiran Khatri
